Years ago I worked at a pasta plant and the #1 thing they cooked there were the books!

They (local plant management) literally had two separate sets of records for everything. The real ones and the ones they showed all us employees implying that we were not profitable enough to get raises or bonuses.

The well-meaning corporate level owners screwed up bad (They literally didn't know their local management was cooking our books at the plant so they could snag our profit share allotment for themselves when it came out.) and ran a front-page ad in the local newspaper bragging up how we had a massive record-setting profits year that was something like $10 MILLION after operating expenses and was going to do a public park party for the whole town for it.

Shit got real. Tuns out the old school Italian 'Pasta Mofia' are super nice to those that make them money and not so nice to those that try to steal it from us. 🤑
